name: MessageDefinition
description: Defines the characteristics of a message that can be shared between systems, including the type of event that initiates the message, the content to be transmitted and what response(s), if any, are permitted.

elements.name: id
elements.short: Logical id of this artifact
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.short: Metadata about the resource
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.short: Language of the resource content
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.short: Contained, inline Resources
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Business Identifier for a given MessageDefinition
elements.description: The business identifier that is used to reference the MessageDefinition and *is* expected to be consistent from server to server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: identifier
elements.short: Primary key for the message definition on a given server
elements.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this message definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the message definition
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the message definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the message definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this message definition (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the message definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Name for this message definition (human friendly)
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the message definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: replaces
elements.short: Takes the place of
elements.description: A MessageDefinition that is superseded by this definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
elements.description: The status of this message definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this message definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.short: Date last changed
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the message definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the message definition changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the message definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.short: Contact details for the publisher
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the message definition
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the message definition from a consumer's perspective.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate message definition instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for message definition (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the message definition is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this message definition is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this message definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: copyright
elements.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
elements.description: A copyright statement relating to the message definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the message definition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: base
elements.short: Definition this one is based on
elements.description: The MessageDefinition that is the basis for the contents of this resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: parent
elements.short: Protocol/workflow this is part of
elements.description: Identifies a protocol or workflow that this MessageDefinition represents a step in.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: event[x]
elements.short: Event code  or link to the EventDefinition
elements.description: Event code or link to the EventDefinition.

binding.description: One of the message events defined as part of this version of FHIR.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: category
elements.short: consequence | currency | notification
elements.description: The impact of the content of the message.

binding.description: The impact of the content of a message.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: focus
elements.short: Resource(s) that are the subject of the event
elements.description: Identifies the resource (or resources) that are being addressed by the event.  For example, the Encounter for an admit message or two Account records for a merge.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Max must be postive int or *

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: code
elements.short: Type of resource
elements.description: The kind of resource that must be the focus for this message.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: profile
elements.short: Profile that must be adhered to by focus
elements.description: A profile that reflects constraints for the focal resource (and potentially for related resources).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: min
elements.short: Minimum number of focuses of this type
elements.description: Identifies the minimum number of resources of this type that must be pointed to by a message in order for it to be valid against this MessageDefinition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: max
elements.short: Maximum number of focuses of this type
elements.description: Identifies the maximum number of resources of this type that must be pointed to by a message in order for it to be valid against this MessageDefinition.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: responseRequired
elements.short: always | on-error | never | on-success
elements.description: Declare at a message definition level whether a response is required or only upon error or success, or never.

binding.description: HL7-defined table of codes which identify conditions under which acknowledgments are required to be returned in response to a message.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: allowedResponse
elements.short: Responses to this message
elements.description: Indicates what types of messages may be sent as an application-level response to this message.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: message
elements.short: Reference to allowed message definition response
elements.description: A reference to the message definition that must be adhered to by this supported response.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: situation
elements.short: When should this response be used
elements.description: Provides a description of the circumstances in which this response should be used (as opposed to one of the alternative responses).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: graph
elements.short: Canonical reference to a GraphDefinition
elements.description: Canonical reference to a GraphDefinition. If a URL is provided, it is the canonical reference to a [GraphDefinition](graphdefinition.html) that it controls what resources are to be added to the bundle when building the document. The GraphDefinition can also specify profiles that apply to the various resources.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
